items.title: Office Assistant/Production Coordinator
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Project Coordinator/Office Assistant


 


About Zappar


 


We are Zappar, an award winning AR platform and creative studio rolled into one. It's our mission to democratize AR & MR.

Our team have created groundbreaking experiences for the world's biggest brands - showcasing how AR technology can transform packaging, illuminate events and elevate marketing campaigns with innovative, engaging content.

Our ZapWorks toolkit puts the power of AR in the hands of designers and developers, enabling them to push the boundaries of interactive creativity, both with and without code.

We are also the proud creators of ZapBox, the first affordable, mixed reality kit that allows developers and businesses to reimagine how they design, build and create 3D experiences.


 


What you’ll be doing:


 


We’re looking for a proactive cheerful office assistant who can keep everything running smoothly and our office in good shape. In addition, you may be asked to help out with occasional support for our Production team. 


 


Typical tasks would include the below: 


 



  • Taking responsibility for the general tidiness of the office and ensuring it looks its best. 

  • Assisting with Office Administration tasks

  • Managing the dedicated cleaner and building cleaning team.

  • Checking the post room & distributing post/parcels.

  • Maintaining the petty cash provision.

  • Arranging couriers and organising postage.

  • Arranging weekly supermarket order (Friday drinks/office supplies).

  • Arranging the monthly team breakfast. 

  • Keeping on top of office supplies - ensuring stock levels are sufficient and re-ordering as required (water cooler/stationary/printer toner…).

  • Answering the intercom and receiving deliveries.

  • Meeting and greeting visitors and interview candidates.

  • Preparing rooms for internal and external meetings and arranging refreshments where applicable.

  • Liaising with suppliers to fix broken items (ensuring kitchen area/bulbs/office collateral is in good working order).

  • Liaising with our IT support assistant and Workspace management around equipment and keys for new starters.

  • Coordinating large format print orders.

  • Supporting the Production and Business Development teams by preparing, sorting and collating project documentation, downloading and storing project assets

  • Ad hoc support with participating in QA and user test sessions for ongoing project work.


A few things about you:


 



  • Proactive and flexible

  • Good natured and willing to get your hands dirty

  • Super organised and forward thinking

  • Good at pushing back when you need to!


 


Although these things would also be a bonus: 


 



  • Experience working in a creative studio

  • Experience with office maintenance 

  • Owner of a cute dog and willing to bring it to the office/owner of other cute pets and willing to show photos (sorry - you can’t bring those in!)



  •  


 


Other than the exciting work, any other pluses to working at Zappar?


 


Our Zappar family are based in a lovely (dog-friendly!) office in beautiful leafy Chiswick  complete with shower facilities, bike storage and surrounded by some amazing shops, coffee shops and pubs. We operate flexible start and finish times to make life a bit easier for anyone who wants to spend time with their children, join an exercise class or just have a lie in! Every Friday, we have drinks and we also host a monthly Friday breakfast and a quarterly team lunch where we all get together for updates on the company performance. Our socials have included tours of the Sipsmith’s distillery and a team scavenger hunt across London. We truly are at the cutting edge of AR and have just been recognized as one of Fast Company’s ‘World’s Most Innovative Companies’.

items.title: Customer Success Manager
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
About FollowApp Care:


We are a healthcare technology company specialising in AI-driven patient communication. Our current customers are healthcare providers in the Australian, American, and European regions.


We are a growing team based in London with remote team members currently in the UK and Spain. We have plans to expand very quickly with the help of several more contracts underway and recent investment. We are opening a satellite office in Madrid.


We are currently in development and planning phase of the next version of our product, which you will also be a key member in contributing to the process!


 


The position:


You will be working alongside both the Product and Sales Teams.


 


Key tasks you will be involved with are:


Client relationship management



  • Planning and execution of successful delivery of our product to our clients, including training planning and project managing technical data integrations.

  • Set clients up for long term success with FollowApp.

  • Manage and grow CS team

  • Engage in day-to-day communications with clients to ensure successful uptake and maintenance of our technology with our clients. 

  • Work closely with Product and Sales teams to quickly onboard clients, design data solutions and surface issues before they become real problems.

  • Proactively identify onboarding process improvements.

  • Strategically leverage customer feedback to influence the product roadmap.


 


Other tasks:



  • Product development and design process for the next version of our product (!!)

  • Assist with organisation of product timeline and planning.

  • Ad hoc tasks.


 


Ideally you are a person who…



  • Has a bachelor degree 

  • Is ambitious and motivated (absolute key within a startup, which is a nice transition to the next point…)

  • Enjoys working in a startup environment

  • Is tech-savy and quick to understand data technologies, particularly healthcare technologies. 

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

  • Creative, resourceful, detail-oriented and highly organised (problem solver)

  • Self-starter who thrives under ambiguity in a fast-paced, deadline oriented startup environment

  • No minimum years of experience.


 


The location:


Central London (ideal) or Central Madrid depending on the candidate. The candidate would needs be available in London for the first 6 to 8 weeks.


The position is Full Time.


Flexible working environment. Work from the office, or work from home. As long as the work gets done we are happy. We work as a team to support each other.


 


Must Have:


Fluency in Spanish and English.


 


Salary Range:


Dependant on talent and experience. £35-£55k

items.title: Help Desk Technician - 100% Remote
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=56, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content: Do you have experience as a Help Desk Technician working at the IRS? Are you looking to join a new program, leverage and expand your help desk and customer service skills all while working remotely? If you have an Active Public Trust through the IRS and a background in Help Desk Support, than this position might just be for you. Take a look at the details for this project and if interested, please submit your resume to [Click Here to Email Your Resumé] Due to federal security clearance requirements, applicant must be a US Citizen or Permanent Resident with an active Public Trust clearance with MBI. Scope Our Client is providing assistance to the IRS with the deployment of Microsoft Windows 10 and subsequent migration of IRS computers to the Microsoft Windows 10 infrastructure. They are also providing technical resources that will augment currently existing support at the IRS with work products. In addition, this program is focused on offering technical guidance, expertise, and triage support with the aforementioned solutions and the integration of IRS existing technologies. Our client operates a level-one, consolidated customer help desk to serve as the single point of contact (POC) to answer IT/IM trouble calls for approximately 85,000 end users. This program is focused on maintaining a 24x7 call center that conducts preliminary assessment of a call, assistance and direction to resolve real or perceived software problems. Support will include access to include phone, email, and chat capabilities at the appropriate security levels. The objective of this project is to support the continued maintenance of this Windows 10 Deployment, migration and provide help desk support. The Help Desk Analyst Job will support our client's technology group. The technology team provides creative, reliable solutions for our client's internal and external customers. This client provides global services including design, engineering, installation, dispatching, repair, outsourcing and consulting, and project management for a diverse base of network, radio, and applications services supporting information technology systems and networks in industries including finance and retail. This program as stated above is directly supporting the IRS. The Help Desk Analyst will: Initiate and resolve service requests Resolve technical problems and answer queries for hardware, software, network, system/application access, and telecommunications systems Diagnose, identify, isolate, and analyze problems Work with system administrators and developers to ensure services/incidents are completed Provide outstanding customer service experience Requirements of the Help Desk Analyst: Active IRS Public Trust with MBI is required for this position and must be had prior to interview per client request 3 years of technical experience with Help Desk Support and experience working directly with customers via phone and remotely to resolve technical software and hardware issues Technical, hands on experience with Windows 7, 8.1 and Windows 10 migration, Office Pro Plus (Office 2016), Outlook are a must Strong communication skills and ability to work in a fast-paced environment and to learn new technologies Keywords: Help Desk Technician, Public Trust Clearance, Windows, Windows 10 Migration, Office 2016, Outlook, Remote Opportunity Job ID: 318260 About Eliassen Group: Eliassen Group provides strategic talent solutions to drive our clients' innovation and business results. Leveraging over 30 years of success, our expertise in IT staffing, Agile consulting, creative services, managed services, and life sciences enables us to partner with our clients to execute their business strategy and scale effectively. Headquartered in Reading, MA and with offices from coast to coast, Eliassen Group offers local community presence, deep networks, as well as national reach. For more information, visit . Eliassen Group is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. Don't miss out on our referral program If we hire a candidate that you refer us to then you can be eligible for a $1,000 referral check

items.content:
Customer Success Specialist

Support
Europe
£23000-25000
Company: TeamUp
Full Time

Overview

ABOUT US!

TeamUp () is an all-in-one business management solution for independent fitness businesses. Our customers include CrossFit gyms, yoga studios, martial arts centres, and personal trainers.

goteamup.com

Since 2012, Teamup has helped thousands of businesses take control of payments, scheduling, and member management.

Our remote team of 12 is currently based in the UK, US, and Spain.

THE JOB
  • Work directly with fitness business owners/staff via telephone, email and screen sharing to resolve technical issues and business workflow challenges.
  • Coordinate with other members of the success team to get customers up and running in TeamUp as quickly as possible.
  • Create helpdesk content that explains features and details set up steps and best user tips.
  • Write up bug reports and feature requests for our engineering team to review.
  • Review and give feedback on new features before they go live to our customers.
  • Help to maintain a high standard of customer satisfaction.

    • YOU HAVE
    • Native-level English proficiency and are excited to work directly with customers via email, phone or live chat.
    • Determination for every customer to have a great experience with TeamUp and a desire to take responsibility for the customers you are helping to have their query resolved.
    • The ability to translate more complex concepts into easy-to-follow written content.
    • At least intermediate experience using Excel.
    • Experience working in a remote environment (comfortable primarily communicating over platforms like Slack, Skype, Basecamp, Intercom Jira etc.).
    • The schedule to work Monday through Friday, 9am – 5:30pm UTC, with the ability to cover some hours at weekends and on public holidays if required.

      • BONUS POINTS FOR…

      Experience of working with fitness businesses. Experience providing support for a SaaS product.


      WHY WORK FOR US?

      We’re a very small team doing very big things — your work will make a huge impact and your voice will be heard!

      We may not all be in the same location, but you wouldn’t know it. We have great communication platforms in place to ensure you have the resources to succeed in your role at TeamUp.

      We offer a competitive salary, gym membership, the tools you’ll need to do your work, team meetups and a great team atmosphere to help you achieve your best work.

      Salary £23,000-£25,000 per annum (dependant on experience)


      APPLYING FOR THE ROLE 

      To apply for the position of Customer Success Specialist please complete the below steps:

      1. Send a copy of your CV 2. Send a cover letter explaining why you think you’re suitable for this role and why TeamUp is the company for you




      To apply for this job please send your job application to the email below.

      Please reference Jobspresso in your application, so that remote companies know where their best candidates are coming from

      mitch@goteamup.com

items.content:
Application Support Engineer – Long Term Engagement!

United States, California
Company: DISYS

Overview

Digital Intelligence Systems (DISYS) has been engaged to find a talented Application Support Engineer for a foremost Healthcare’s IT Group that is located close to public transit in Oakland, California.


This is a long-term, multi-year project that requires an in-person, final interview and working on-site in Oakland, California. Remote work options are offered for two days a week, once established in the role. Candidates who reside in the Bay Area will be considered.

Use your sharp analytical skills in supporting and maintaining in-depth knowledge of the multi-layered business process management system. Apply your technical skills to the very interesting domain of health care and clinical data management.

This is a hybrid role for a developer who would like to explore business processes and healthcare, or a highly technical Business Analyst who would like to evolve into a more technical role. This resource will work with both our business partners and our technical team to troubleshoot escalated issues, investigate and document root causes, as well as develop solutions and/or tracking resolution from other teams. This is not a traditional support position, but a combination Systems Engineer, Project Manager and Analyst, and is a creative, deeply analytic, research and development role.

Responsibilities include:

  • Function as the primary point of contact for escalated system issues from second level business support.
  • Research/investigate/troubleshoot these areas, narrowing potential root cause down to data definition, algorithmic rules/logic, or application-level issues.
  • If a problem is on the business (requirements) side, help business understand where requirements might need to change to achieve expected system behavior.
  • If a problem is on the technical side, help technical team understand the problem so that technical changes can be made.


Required Credentials:

  • BS or equivalent experience in a technical discipline (programming, analysis, or other strong technical area).
  • Substantive experience with SQL, with fluency to read and write SQL queries, and ability to understand the data model behind a complex system.
  • Ability to understand, trace, and detect logic errors in pseudocode.
  • Experience working with application development and support teams, demonstrating advanced level of business problem solving skills.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively with both business and technical individuals.
  • Ability to manage, drive, prioritize, perform and deliver multiple tasks simultaneously and with quality.

Desired Attributes:

  • MS in a technical discipline
  • Experience/comfort with procedural programming languages a plus (e.g. Java, C, C++). This is not a programming job; however, past experience in this area would make it much easier to handle the Pseudocode (Domain Specific Language) encoding of clinical rules.
  • Experience in a health care setting or healthcare/IT setting.


For more insight into this long-term hiring initiative, please contact Nicole Foster at . Thank you for your interest.

Apply for job

items.title: Technical Support Analyst
items.content:
Technical Support Analyst at Bitfocus

Remote

Location:
Category: Customer Service
Job Type: Full-Time
Job Desc:

Who we are:

Bitfocus is a rapidly growing company working to help communities use data to tackle their greatest social challenges. Our software and services help non-profit, government, and community organizations build effective response systems to homelessness, and are used in more than 75 communities, including high profile communities serving the densest populations of homelessness nationwide.

Operating on the front-line, the Technical Support Team is comprised of cross-disciplinary experts that assist our customers ensure they are making the most effective use of our products and services.

What you’ll do:

  • Provide daily system, administrative, and operational support
  • Become a subject matter expert (SME) of our Clarity Human Services software
  • Become a subject matter expert (SME) on Continuum of Care activities
  • System management
  • Quality assurance
  • System configuration to meet local client objectives
  • Data analytics
  • Managing support desk tickets, and maintaining Service Level Agreements
  • Serving as a technical resource for user documentation
  • Project management
  • Generating reports
  • Developing and maintaining databases for reporting
  • Developing problem resolution by analyzing processing problems
  • Recommending solutions and working with other departments to test and implement solutions

What we’d love you to bring:
Our ideal candidate has a background in HMIS, homeless services, and/or the human services system.

  • Experience using a Homeless Management Information System (HMIS)
  • Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills
  • A strong analytical background
  • Adaptable and able to effectively multi-task

Software Skills Required:

  • Advanced Microsoft Excel (Crosstabs, Pivots, Formulas)
  • Experience working with Help Desk software a plus

Skills Required:

  • Strong technical, analytical, communication & organizational skills
  • Principles of computer data processing, business systems applications, techniques of software and systems quality assurance and control

Qualifications:

  • College Degree in computer science, social work or related field strongly preferred but not required
  • Computer proficiency, knowledge of SQL databases a plus, but not required
  • Preferably 1 year experience in a related field
  • Technical aptitude

What we offer:
In addition to a smart team of dedicated and friendly colleagues, we offer the following compensation and benefits:

  • Full-time employment (40 hrs a week)
  • Salary: DOQ
  • Remote Work (requires a quiet home office environment)
  • Apple iMac computer and VoIP phone provided for your home office
  • Medical, Dental and Vision insurance plans, 401k, Paid Time Off, Paid Volunteer Time Off, Sick Leave, Holidays
Apply for job

items.content:
Technical Customer Support

Overview

With over 10,000 online merchants launching subscriptions and over 1,000,000 subscribers powered by ReCharge we're processing tens of millions of dollars in sales every week. Our mission ‘making repeat orders easier for everyone' began four years ago as a bootstrapped startup and today we're at the forefront of recurring billing software with over 100 remote-first employees around the globe.

In a Technical Customer Support role based remotely for our Customer Success team, you’ll be responsible for supporting our customers and delivering a world-class support experience. You’ll work closely with store owners to troubleshoot and resolve issues via email, chat, and occasional phone calls.

What You'll Do
  • Live by and champion our values: #ownership, #empathy, #simple-solutions.
  • Use your technical expertise and customer service skills to resolve questions and issues for our online merchants
  • Communicate clearly in writing to both technical and non-technical people
  • Document and build new tools to improve support flows
  • Identify patterns, recommend improvements, and filter out unimportant issues
  • Author documentation for our customer-facing Help Center
  • Assist with successful on-boarding of new customers
What You'll Bring
  • 2+ years of experience in technical customer support at a SaaS company, or similar
  • Proficiency with a ticketing technology platform: i.e. HelpScout, Zendesk preferred
  • Resourcefulness: you'll figure out what needs to be done, and you find ways to make it happen
  • A passion for problem solving: an excitement for a tricky problem or a new challenge
  • A sense of urgency and a satisfaction from going above and beyond to provide solutions
  • An exceptional eye for detail and excellent organizational and communication skills
  • Ability to work remotely and desire to make an impact at a boot-strapped start-up
  • Excellent customer service and English fluency (written and spoken)
  • A ‘winning as a team’ attitude and a polite, patient, caring, calm and professional demeanor 
  • Basic knowledge of HTML, CSS, Javascript (knowledge of other programming languages a plus)
  • Ability to work flexible shifts

items.content:
Executive Assistant at Tendermint

Remote | Entry-level

San Francisco Bay Area

Operations

Full-time

About us:

Tendermint is building state-of-the-art consensus and networking protocols to enable internet-scale distributed applications. We’re passionate, self-driven, industry leaders whose mission is to build a better, freer internet. We’re also building the Cosmos Network, a decentralized network of independent parallel blockchains, each powered by classical BFT consensus algorithms like Tendermint Core. We believe the technology we’re building will have a major impact on human beings around the world. We’re well funded and growing quickly.

How we work:

Most of us work out of our offices in San Francisco, Berkeley, Toronto, and Berlin, but some of our employees work remotely. Communication is important to us and we rely heavily on Slack and Zoom to help us stay in sync.

This is a full time position and can be located in any of our offices, or 100% remote.

What you will be doing:

  • Supporting the CEO in setting up schedules for meetings in different timezones
  • Serving as key contact between the CEO and internal/external clients, including prospecting and cold calling
We’re looking for someone who has:
  • At least 2 years of experience with scheduling meetings using the G Suite
  • Immediate availability to start and work in the Pacific Standard Timezone (PST)
  • Open to helping with personal matters for the CEO

Nice to have:

  • Knowledge of a second language
  • Experience working with remote teams

What we offer:

  • The opportunity to be part of building the future of the Internet
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Excellent benefits like educational budget, fitness and wellbeing spend
  • At least 4 weeks of paid vacation
  • Competitive salary package, including equity
Apply for job

items.title: Senior Business Psychologist - Client Success
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Senior Business Psychologist - Client Success


Who are we?


We're an innovative and fast-growing psychometric tech business; our solutions combine neuroscience, artificial intelligence and game technology that aim to disrupt the candidate selection process. We process large amounts of data from the behavioural assessments we develop and then put it all through our analytics engines to derive insights into personality traits and behaviours. As a company, we believe technology will underpin everything we do in the future and our goal.


 


Our vision is to create a more diverse and fulfilled workforce and our value is in helping companies make better people choices and people better career choices. We do this by creating and delivering scientifically robust, innovative and user centred assessments that support more objective and informed choices.


 


What we are looking for:


We're looking for a Senior Business Psychologist to join our Client Success team based in our brand-new WeWork offices in Waterloo.


 


The purpose of this role it to support clients in the use of our assessments to ensure best practice use, return on investment and increased future use across other client organisations. This calls for the application of extensive experience of statistical analysis in order to deliver insights to clients and to supervise other members of the team.


 


You will work closely with colleagues in the Science team to share client insights and data for the continuous improvement of our product. You will also be able to drive specific improvement projects both to develop our assessments and innovate in the psychometric testing space. 


 


 


What your days will look like:



  • Supporting where required on content for sales pitches

  • Managing client projects end-to-end

  • Allocating work and supervising Assistant Business Psychologists and Business Psychologists within projects

  • Providing expertise in all aspects of implementation (e.g. job analysis, statistical analysis as part of predictive and concurrent validation studies, fit profile creation)

  • Being the first point of contact for clients

  • Providing support to the Business Development Team in growing client accounts by owning the client review process in the lead up to licence renewal

  • Contributing to the growth of Arctic Shores’ platform in the marketplace through responsibility and ownership over the delivery of projects


 


What we’re looking for:



  • MSc in Occupational Psychology or equivalent.

  • Certificate of Competence in Occupational Testing (Ability and Personality).

  • Experience of managing senior client relationships and of supervising junior psychologists.

  • Experience in supporting new business and / or growth of client accounts.

  • Experience of delivering £20K+ projects.

  • Experienced user of SPSS, R or other statistical packages and ability to run regression, correlations, ANOVAs etc.

  • English language written and spoken skills.


 


Here's what we offer:



  • A community-driven and relaxed work culture, which you'll fit right into. Part of this includes a regular games night and social events.

  • A chance to work with a standout and disruptive product that's shaping the HR market and candidate experience.

  • A voice in your team where you can be heard and have a direct influence on how we create our products.

  • Working hours that are flexible to life outside of work.

  • A central location that's easy to commute to. 

  • Flexibility to work from home on a weekly basis.

  • 2 mental wellbeing days.

  • 25 days annual leave + bank holidays.

  • A dynamic working office in WeWork, where you can revel in the cosy co-working spaces or shut out the world with your headphones on.

  • Free breakfast on Mondays, onsite barista and bar, and weekly events and talks where you can learn from other local businesses.


 


Equal Opportunities


At Arctic Shores, giving people a fair chance is what we do, that's why we take equal opportunities seriously. We welcome people of any background, gender identification, race, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, ability-level, age, size, marital status, style or music taste!


 


If we sound like the kind of place you’d like to work, apply below or get in touch with Kirsty, she's our Head of Client Success at kirsty.nolan@arcticshores.com.

items.title: Flyt: Customer Operations
items.content:
Customer Operations

The Role

  • We’re looking for someone to support the squads responsible for deploying multiple Point Of Sale (POS) integration projects globally (UK, EU, US, AUS).
  • You’ll optimise tools & processes to ensure we’re able to run faster to achieve our deployment goals.
  • You’ll have a clear view of what needs to be completed across all projects before go-live and understand how your individual contribution adds value to what the squad delivers.
  • As a critical member of a cross-functional squad, you’ll be results-driven and use your initiative to suggest new ways of working.

What you’ll do:

  • Build menu information from various source formats (e.g. excel/PDF/JSON files etc.) and map that between different systems
  • On-board new merchants: account set-up, location configuration etc.
  • Create testing scripts and end to end test the menu, price bands, orders etc.
  • Proactively resolve discrepancies in information / obtaining further information
  • Participate actively in your squads weekly project meetings to understand the “why” of the work you’re undertaking
  • Update existing menu data upon request

Requirements


We’re confident you’ll love working here if:

  • You want to get into the trenches with a collaborative team.
  • You want to help deliver innovative software products.
  • You class yourself as a continuous improver, and constantly push yourself outside of your comfort zone.
  • You like to openly communicate, be willing to listen to peers and give and receive continuous feedback.

Benefits

  • Remote Working
  • £22,000 - £26,000
  • Bonus Pool
  • A great working environment, regular office events and a culture of creating unique experiences for our employees
  • Macbook pro - top spec.
  • The training you need to help you level-up (up to £1,000/y)
  • The opportunity to work in a fast-growing company with global expansion plans and operations spanning USA, UK, and Australia.
  • Pension - 3% matched to 5%
  • 25 days holiday
Cycle to work scheme – www.cyclescheme.co.uk

items.title: Team Assistant (m/f/d) // RCS Global Group
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
Team Assistant (m/f/d) // RCS Global Group

Company: RCS Global Group

Tags:
  • HR
  • Office Management
  • Assistant

    • About RCS Global Group

    RCS Global Group is the leading advisory firm working with companies across the world to identify and manage environmental, social and governance risks in their supply chains. This includes – inter alia – customer-facing automotive and electronics brands in the United States and Europe, battery and other manufacturers in Asia, and mining operators around the world.

    Our vision is a world where natural resources are produced, traded and transformed in a way that generates sustainable positive impacts on people and planet.

    We do this by bringing transparency and good practice to every point of companies supply chains from source to store, including through supplier audit programs, product traceability, as well as data solutions for supply chain monitoring.

    Role:

    As Team Assistant, based in our Berlin office, you will play a key role for our global team by supporting  a wide-range of operational topics.  Tasks will range from the support of day-to-day operations coordinating all operational administrative tasks, tools and software maintenance, to event support and preparatory accounting and HR topics. Furthermore, you’ll be in touch daily with our other worldwide offices in China, the United Kingdom, Rwanda, and The Democratic Republic of Congo for administrative support. In this position you have the chance to work in an exciting international environment with personalities who are shaping the responsible sourcing industry.

    Responsibilities:

    Day to day Operations: – Global/Berlin

    • Coordinate all operational administrative tasks for country offices, remote workers, and Berlin office
    • Scheduling and preparation of meetings
    • Assist with Berlin’s monthly invoicing and bookkeeping (reporting to Operations Manager and Finance Manager)
    • Maintenance of, and assistance with, all tools and software
    • Back-end maintenance of all company policies, tools, and information storage under the supervision of the Operations Manager
    • Assist with company training for internal processes and tools

    HR Management – Group / Berlin 

    • Act as liaison for team-wide and Germany specific HR matters
    • Maintain internal training database for accreditations, internal processes and tools
    • Lead on team building organisation and company culture
    • Support recruitment processes to the point of interview
    • Maintenance and upgrading of company policies for onboarding / offboarding management
    • Maintenance of HR files and system, with implementation of HR resources i.e. Training schedules, company surveys etc.
    • 6-month staff review management with implementation of 360-degree review process

    Marketing & Communications support 

    • Organisation of RCS Global’s events, webinars and workshops and all related administrative organisational tasks
    • Website content management assistance
    • Participate in stakeholder events and conferences as required, write briefing notes and/or report back to the rest of the team.

    Requirements:

    • Minimum of 2 years of experience working in a similar position
    • Tech savvy, – you need to have the ability to quickly learn productivity-, and other new tools
    • Full proficiency in Google Suite
    • First-hand experience in HR-Management
    • Experience in working in an international environment
    • Ability to work proactively and independently without constant oversight
    • Fluent in English, German should be minimum B2, French is a plus
    • Experience with remote teams is a plus

    What you can expect: 

    • Meaningful work aimed to have a positive impact on the world
    • A young, highly ambitious, multi-cultural team working for some of the biggest brands in the world
    • An amazing office in the center of Berlin
    • Our Chief Happiness Officer, Blue (a 6-month old puppy)
    • Flexible working schedule with an occasional home office option
    • Competitive compensation
    Apply for this position

items.content:
Senior Member Success Specialist

Support
US Eastern Time Zone
Company: Scott’s Cheap Flights
Full Time

Overview

As a Senior Specialist on our Member Success Team, you will be a key contributor to the growth, innovation, and continued improvement of the Member Success Team at Scott’s Cheap Flights. You will be collaborating with a lean team to educate and engage our members, and help them find success with the Scott’s Cheap Flights product.

In the short term, you will:
  • Learn about our product and our members, with the goal of deeply understanding both of them
  • Serve as an advocate for our members across the team and company
  • Respond to member inquiries via email, taking a positive and empathetic approach to each conversation
  • Work on (or potentially lead) cross-functional initiatives that address one of the core pillars of our company vision
  • Think critically about and participate in improving current Member Success tools, processes, and procedures
  • Collaborate with cross-functional project team groups to support the design & creation of new products and features

    • In the long term, you will:
    • Become an expert on our members and translate their wants and needs into product and process improvements
    • Identify and implement scalable solutions to improve how we’re communicating with members, team members, and cross-functional partners
    • Independently use appropriate qualitative and quantitative data points to tell member stories within and beyond the Member Success team

      • What you bring to the table:
      • 2-5 years of customer support experience, preferably B2C via email
      • Superior written communication skills and clear, concise, and warm verbal communication
      • Superior analytical reading skills
      • Experience working cross-functionally with Product, Marketing, Design and/or Engineering teams
      • Ability to tell a data-driven customer story
      • Ability to provide clear, actionable feedback to team members, manager, and cross-functional partners
      • Initiative to solve in-depth member/intra-team problems
      • Creativity, resourcefulness, and solution-focused mindset
      • Agility; you’re willing, able, and excited to embrace change
      • Able to work for an 9-hour period (inclusive of a one-hour lunch break) between 9am and 9pm ET, Monday through Friday, and occasionally on weekends
      • Must be legally authorized to work in the United States.

        • Nice to have’s:
        • Experience in the travel industry
        • Previous support of customers through social media
        • Previous leadership of projects in a customer service department
        • Experience working remotely

          • Tools we use:
          • Kustomer
          • Notion
          • Slack
          • Iterable

            • Why you might love working here:
            • 100% remote work environment, so go ahead and bring your dog to work or wear your PJ’s to the office
            • Open vacation policy, with a 3 week minimum!
            • Comprehensive health, vision, and dental insurance
            • 401(k) with a 5% match
            • Up to 12-weeks of paid family leave
            • Meetup meals when you cross paths with a co-worker
            • Continuing education & development reimbursement
            • Yearly team retreat (this year we went to Riviera Maya!)
            • Challenging problems to solve and an awesome team to collaborate with every single day

              • We want you to bring your whole self to work every single day. We accept you for who you are and consider everyone on an equal opportunity basis without regard to race, national origin, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

items.content:
Junior Customer Success Manager / Support Specialist at Referral Rock

Remote

This is a growth opportunity where you can put your mark on an early-stage company and help us grow. Referral Rock is a fast-growing Referral Marketing SaaS for small and medium-sized businesses.

You’ll help customers set up and run successful referral programs and campaigns. You’ll become a referral marketing guru, providing industry-leading advice and creating winning strategies with your customers.

You’re a coach, working with your customers to make sure they’re successful. This is a high-velocity position where you must manage multiple accounts at once.

You will be on a customer success team of 3 where we value every member’s contributions and work fluidly with both the product and sales teams.

Responsibilities:
  • On-board and coach new customers to successfully set up and launch their referral programs
  • Manage our sales/customer online chat tool during EST online hours
  • Understand customers’ health scores and key success drivers
  • Proactively remedy issues and actively reach out to customers to prevent churn
  • Contribute to the development of new material and documentation
  • Be the internal spokesperson for your customers, relaying key information and product requests
  • Help customers implement referral marketing best practices
  • Help customers integrate their referral programs with their business workflows and systems. From Marketing to Sales (CRMs, Zapier, Javascript, their website, eCommerce, and more).

Ideal Candidates:

  • 1-3 years of high-volume account management experience
  • Experience developing and running data-driven marketing campaigns (i.e. email marketing, content development, landing page and conversion optimization, SEO, etc.) is a plus
  • Understanding of HTTP, JavaScript, cookies, browser tracking
  • Experience working with SMBs
  • Experience in a marketing role and/or a marketing tech company is a plus
  • Obsess over your customers’ success
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication
  • Ability to work remotely
  • Comfortable using data to drive decision making
  • Ability to quickly and effectively troubleshoot problems
  • Experience with common sales & marketing software like Salesforce, HubSpot, Intercom, and MailChimp
  • Visual design experience is a plus
Benefits
  • Medical and Dental
  • Flexibile PTO and Holidays

As a remote team, you’ll have a greater responsibility to work within our systems like Asana, HubSpot, Intercom, Zoom, Confluence, and Slack. These tools are our work operating system here at Referral Rock. You’ll be expected to have excellent communication skills and an exceptional level of accountability. We have weekly team meetings and daily remote stand-ups where you’d be required to update the team on your progress.

If you think startups don’t mean process then this isn’t the job for you. We document everything, follow onboarding and account management playbooks, use data to monitor health scores and engagement, and are constantly improving how we can make our customers, their customers, and our internal team more successful. If you get excited about building a repeatable process then this could be the right team for you.

If none of this scares you, please apply.

Location: Authorized to Work in US, work in EST, live anywhere

Apply for job

items.title: Technical Support Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=8, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Technical Support Engineer


Network Assurance  | Up to £25k p.a. | Old Street, London 


At Pod Point we’re changing the way people drive.  We fundamentally believe that travel shouldn’t damage the Earth so we’ve made it our mission to install a Pod Point (an Electric Vehicle charging point) everywhere you park. To make that vision a reality, we need the brightest, most tenacious and most inspiring talent in the world - we are growing faster than the market and we need to maintain that velocity - that’s where you come in!


The Role


We’re looking for an exceptional 2nd Line Support professional to join our growing team. This is a fantastic opportunity to work within a passionate team and have a big impact on the entire organisation. You will collaborate with the team to insure that Pod Point’s network achieves the highest levels of network reliability and uptime. You will work closely with the other team members to provide solutions to our customers and clients which ensure top notch product reliability; you will report into the Network Assurance Manager and will be based out of our offices near Old Street Station in London. 


What you’ll do



  • Provide technical support for the Pod Point charging network, handling incoming calls that are raised as a level 2 support issue

  • Escalate problems and provide detailed handovers to 3rd line support when necessary

  • Log all information accurately and in a timely manner whilst building rapport with internal members of staff

  • Work closely with the Customer Support team as well as the Technical (Product) teams

  • Organise remote Electricians to resolve issues and assist in fault finding

  • Ensure tickets are properly managed, and that notes are kept up to date

  • Continuously participate in creating tools and processes which increase the number of issues which can be resolved by the Level 1 support team

  • Continuously improve and develop the efficiency of your own processes


What you’ll need



  • Previous experience in a technical support role

  • Familiar with Google Drive, Docs and Sheets and experience working with a range of systems including a CRM system (ideally Salesforce)

  • A strong interest in technology, and the ability to pick up new technology quickly

  • Strong attention to detail


What’s “Nice to have” but not essential



  • Previous experience in electrical field servicing

  • Familiar with Salesforce

  • Good understanding of electronics and electrical components

  • A dog that you can bring into the office

  • Passionate and knowledgeable about the EV industry


And if you’re not sure whether you’re what we’re looking for - send us your CV anyway!  We love to hear from people who are passionate about what we do, and we always take the view that a good cultural fit (and mission alignment) is much more important than ticking all the “qualifications, skills and experience” boxes.


Our culture is electric


At Pod Point we like to think we are anything but conventional. We have worked hard to create a rapidly-growing, constantly innovating, flat-structured world, where each employee can see the vital contribution they are making to the company. We knew from the very beginning that a rigid, corporate environment was never going to work for us, and we have stayed true to our word - we’re anything but.


We work hard; we’re not clock-watchers but equally you may find yourself working into the evening very occasionally. In return we’ll pay you well, give you complete ownership to shape the role, give you ground-breaking projects to work on and surround you with fantastic, talented people. We also provide the following benefits:



  • Flexible working hours and a casual dress code

  • 25 days holiday (plus bank holidays)

  • Very generous maternity and paternity leave scheme

  • Pension scheme

  • Eyecare scheme

  • Bike to work scheme and discounted gym membership

  • An extensive non-fiction library to provide a bit of inspiration

  • The odd Pod Point puppy to cuddle.


Pod Point is an equal opportunities employer, although you must be legally able to work in UK, and any data you provide us will be stored and disseminated in accordance with Pod Point’s Privacy Policy.


We like to deal directly with our candidates so no agencies please!

items.content:
At WeGift, we’re enabling value to go further, move faster and be used more freely. We’re completely reinventing the digital branded currency category, and creating a world where everyone has access to the global economy wth no banks, borders, boundaries or bullshit. To date we have built the industry’s premier digital rewards platform and are already working with the world’s leading brands like Amazon, Nike and Uber and corporate partners like Sky, Coinbase and Vodafone. Together we’re helping millions of people around the world store, send and spend value like never before.


We recognise that building a world class business requires a world class effort, so we make sure that each team member is appreciated for the unique value and skills they bring. We are driven by the knowledge that there are still millions of businesses and consumers (in a £600 billion industry!) that we can help. If you’re looking for an environment that will inspire you to dream bigger, work harder and make a difference every day, you’re in the right place.


On a day to day basis you will:



  • Deliver first class customer experience by responding to customer requests and queries promptly and professionally.

  • Work closely with other teams across the company to solve problems and ensure the best possible outcomes.

  • Generate and suggest systematic solutions to solve repeating queries or anticipate customer future needs.

  • Coordinate our customer support responses over a number of platforms including Zendesk, Intercom and Twitter.

  • Maintain great relationships with our brand and e-commerce partners, and work with them when necessary to solve queries.

  • Analyse our current customer support processes, so that they can be refined and optimised.

  • Develop expertise across all of our products and be able to identify when an issue should be escalated.


Requirements 



  • Previous experience working in customer support or customer service.

  • Strong IT and technical skills with the ability to learn new software.

  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.

  • Able to work under pressure and put customers at ease.

  • Able to work autonomously as well as being a positive team player.


Benefits 



  • Pension scheme (3% contribution)

  • A minimum of 25 days holiday + bank holidays (we’re not too descriptive about holidays so if you need more time off then just ask).

  • Staff perks with WeGift brands - discounts of up to 12% on coffee, weekly groceries, holidays, the list is endless.

  • Flexible hours and work from home when needed - yes, yes everyone says this but we do.

  • WeRecognise, where we shine the spotlight on exceptional employees every month who in turn get a £200 award in the eGift card of their choice.

  • Personal development budget - well actually there is no budget as we don’t believe in putting a cap on learning new things.

  • Generous maternity and paternity packages to make sure you get to spend time with your new bundle of joy.

  • Fully licensed as a tier 2 sponsor + relocation packages to help you get settled in.


Perks



  • Brand new WeWork office based in Monument, London.

  • A new laptop as standard - no one wants an old one when they need to be doing their best work + all the trimmings you need to get the perfect work setup.

  • Catered lunch once a week.

  • Monthly team socials (Escape Rooms, Karaoke - everyone gets a chance to choose what this looks like)

  • Cycle to work scheme - save some £££ on buying a bike


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

items.title: Product Support Specialist
items.content:
About Culture Amp


Culture Amp helps you make your company a better place to work. By making it easy to collect, understand and act on employee feedback, we enable HR leaders to make better decisions, demonstrate impact, and turn company culture into a competitive edge.

Culture Amp’s on-demand platform is designed and supported by psychologists and data scientists to help you build an employee feedback program that will work for your organization. Working with Culture Amp allows you to tap into the creativity and experience of over 1000 innovative companies using Culture Amp to put culture first today.

Culture Amp launched the world’s first on-demand employee feedback platform in 2012. Backed by Sapphire Ventures, Index Ventures, Felicis Ventures and Blackbird Ventures, we support our fast-growing global customer base from offices in Melbourne, San Francisco, New York and London.

 


The Opportunity at Culture Amp


You are deeply curious and passionate about people and culture. At heart, you're what we call a People Geek. Culture Amp is looking for an exceptional Product Support Specialist to join us in our mission to make as many culture-first companies possible through accessible people analytics. 


As one of the members of this business-critical team, you will:



  • Serve as the first point of contact for our customers around the world that reach out to us via our support channels (email, chat, phone, video conference) 

  • Answer all questions related to the Culture Amp platform and escalate when necessary (we receive around 2,000 customer requests per month!)

  • Be a customer advocate by providing feedback to the product and engineering team on improving the platform to better solve our customers’ challenges

  • Educate and empower our customers to be better Culture Amp users and become People Geeks

  • Serve as an internal resource for all departments at Culture Amp to help them be successful

  • Partner with the Customer organization across multiple time zones (we are a globally distributed team) to continuously improve our customer experience as our customer base grows

  • Help create and drive the metrics we use to evaluate Customer Support, including quality, effectiveness, speed, and volume

  • Serve as an extension of the Support Lead and make critical decisions otherwise blocking customers and Customer Support Specialists


What You Bring to Our Camp


Technical skills and Experience 



  • At least 2 years of experience in Technical Support in a B2B SaaS environment

  • Ability to evaluate, troubleshoot, and follow-up on customer issues as well as replicate and document for further escalation

  • Experience using help desk systems such as Zendesk, Freshdesk, Help Scout, etc.

  • Comfortable working with spreadsheets (XLS and CSV files) 


Soft Skills



  • You enjoy interacting with people and building relationships with your customers

  • You are able to empathise with customers in a genuine way that lets them know you care about their issues

  • You’re a team player that can follow and lead as situations dictate

  • You’re able to make decisions and solve problems

  • You have an ability to explain technical issues in simple terms

  • You have a natural ability to “zoom-out” of a problem, in order to ask the right questions.

  • You have a flair for technology and love investigating complex technical issues

items.title: Assistant creative director- Intern
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Welcome !


We are an exciting London based creative tech agency. We provide digital solutions for our clients through web & app development. We have a creative team of animators, computer geeks, I.T geniuses and tech enthusiast.


 


Currently creativity is the backbone to what makes Jelingu thrive as an agency and an essential element of our brand. Strong creative direction ensures company growth as well as our relevance in todays industry. Some of our past clients included- BBC, Ford, Rimmel London, Ali Baba, and London Fashion Week.


 


Job Post Assistant Creative director - Intern


 


As a creative director you would be responsible for managing the creative vision and direction of our brand and that of our clients. You will be managing campaigns both digital and offline and also managing our in-house and external creative. As well as creativity strong managerial skills are an essential element of this position. Directing videos campaign concepts, Managing cinematographers  ,video Content production ,Client creative direction, Organising photoshoot and videos shoots


 


Typical work activities


• Managing and creating both online and offline campaigns


• Creative direction for client projects


• Managing content production logistics and team


• Managing external teams and partners


 


Requirements


• Exemplary planning and time management skills


• High level verbal and written communications skills


• Good understanding of marketing and fundamental concepts


• We love people that can bring forward fresh ideas


• Creativity


• Brilliant people person and communications skills


• Keen to learn and grow with the company


 


*Ideally someone from a fashion background, as we have several clients within the fashion scene.


 


Flexible working 


 


If you feel you meet the criteria for this intern position we would love to hear from you. This intern position is flexible.

items.title: Executive Assistant to CEO and CFO
items.content:
The company:


Gelmetix Ltd. ( https://www.gelmetix.com/ ) is a small, but exciting scientific bio/med tech start-up that has spun out of Manchester University, and aims to provide affordable, non-invasive alternatives to surgery. Gelmetix has offices in London, Paris and Manchester.


The Company is small, but growing, and now urgent requires the right person to support the busy CEO and Company Secretary/CFO with all their numerous priorities.   


 


The candidate:


You’ll be a flexible and ambitious individual who loves to be kept busy, thrives in a challenging environment, can work independently or with others, juggle numerous priorities and can demonstrate initiative and success in previous roles.


 


The Executive Assistant role:


This is a hands-on Executive Assistant role; you’ll be supporting two extremely busy Company Executives by providing first rate support.


 


As an Executive Assistant to the CEO & Company Secretary/CFO, your duties are to:


 



  • Manage a broad range of priorities

  • Provide more the more complex administrative support to the CEO & Company Secretary

  • Schedule and organise internal and external meetings, including the venue or call details

  • Oversight and organisation of the bi-weekly and monthly management and Board meetings, including agenda preparation and organisation

  • Collate and timely distribution of the bi-weekly, monthly and Board management reports

  • Attend meetings, take meeting minutes and ensure final sign-off and record of Board minutes

  • Assist the Company Secretary to:

    • Run internal meetings, including to attend meetings where required

    • Maintain the Company's documents by ensuring accessible and up-to-date records of key Company Documents (i.e. Articles of Association, Investment Agreements, Share Cap Tables, etc.)

    • Support with shareholder communications, including administration and support of Company resolutions or special resolutions

    • Support with the fundraising administration, including: Support investors to deliver their documents, the collection, filing and management of legal documents received from investors, support in preparation of share certificates, etc.

    • Liaise with a broad range of senior stakeholders via call, email and in meetings




Personal Attributes and Qualifications


Desirable



  • Minimum of 5+ years of previous experience or exposure to Company Secretary, Legal or Accounting activities of a Company

  • Legal or Accounting qualification or in-progress


Required



  • Minimum of 3+ years of previous experience as an Executive Assistant, Personal Assistant or Assistant Company Secretary

  • Experience of minute taking

  • Degree educated or equivalent

  • Excellent interpersonal skills

  • Lots of initiative, flexibility and a positive attitude

  • Highly organised: able to manage busy workloads and manage upwards when required

  • Strong prioritisation skills

  • High professional standards with meticulous attention to detail


 


Other key job details:  



  • We are looking for someone to start right away

  • Minimum of 20-25 hours per week, with the option to take on more responsibilities and more hours per week

  • We can provide a consulting or employment contract

  • The Central London office is near Victoria Station and is close to numerous transport links

  • Some flexibility regarding your working hours

  • Some flexibility to work from home

items.title: Executive assistant
items.content:
We are looking for an Executive Assistant to join us remotely to support our CEO and CTO. You’ll be the single best part to giving back time to the Founders of the business, allowing them to focus on what they do best. The goal of this role is to help the Founders run faster. 


At nPlan, we are all about making construction more predictable via a comprehensive understanding of plan outcomes, and a crucial part of that is being able to deliver deep insights for very large construction schedules. We're working with some of the largest infrastructure projects in the world, which means an opportunity to have true impact on the world around us.


 


What you’ll do:



  • Ensure each day runs smoothly by providing secretarial, administrative and project support services.

  • Manage CEO’s calendar & inbox, proactively ensuring emails are answered, follow-ups are planned and meetings are planned well.

  • Edit presentations to improve aesthetics. 

  • Preparation and prioritisation of letters, documents and presentations.

  • Arrange travel involving the co-ordination of detailed travel schedules, itineraries, and all related travel requirements.

  • Deal with Executive expense claims and other administrative tasks.

  • Assist with event management and organisation, such as meetings and social events.

  • Provide support to others of the business if required.


 


What you need to have:



  • A personality that is driven by helping others.

  • Proactive at finding ways to help others.

  • Highly organised with a keen attention to detail.

  • Proven working experience as an executive assistant or personal assistant, ideally at a technology or software company. 

  • Strong written communication skills (email). 

  • Proficient at Slack, GSuite and Whatsapp.


 


What it’ll be like working with us:



  • We’re a young and fast growing company. You’ll be exposed to the heart of it, which makes us an exciting place to work.

  • You’ll have freedom with your time. We don’t count or watch the clock, which means you can work when you want and where you want, as long as you get stuff done. 

  • This particular role is fully remote but if you ever want to (or sometimes we may ask you to) come into the office and spend time with us, that option will be made available to you. 

  • We love it if you could mention the word “crane” in your application, it shows you read this far and have attention to detail ;-)

  • We don’t take ourselves too seriously

  • We take pride in solving big and difficult problems, and in doing so, we’ve assembled a world-class team. You’ll be in good company.

items.title: Customer Experience Associate
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)

items.content:
We’re looking for an enthusiastic, intuitive and highly organised Customer Experience Associate to join our team.


If you’ve worked in copywriting, community management, research roles and/or customer experience and you thrive in a fast-paced and collaborative environment, this role could be for you.


We’re building Thriva to make a real difference in people’s lives. We’re doing something revolutionary, and we don’t have all of the answers (or even all of the questions). Our Customer Experience Associate will be instrumental in helping us work out how to improve Thriva for our customers and helping them to get the most value out of our product.


As part of the Customer Experience Team, you’ll become a communication expert, working across internal teams to ensure client satisfaction. You’ll take part in user-centered insight projects, manage our Thriva help centre (FAQs), and run our social media customer support function.


While we do have teams with different specialties and focus, most of our work spans across multiple areas. This means you’ll work with lots of different people on a range of challenging problems. We set quarterly goals which means you’ll always know what you’re doing today is going to help grow the company over the next few months.


Startup life can be tough sometimes, so we like to bring as much fun as we can to the office!


 


What will you be doing day to day?


Your days will be varied and challenging, often working on lots of exciting projects at once.


In executing your role, you’ll:



  • execute all insight research operations: composing insight request emails in the Thriva tone and organising sessions

  • participate in phone, email and in-person customer insight research when necessary

  • be the voice of the customer when working on cross-functional team projects

  • consistently track patterns and trends, and identify areas of improvement within the customer support function, with the assistance of the Customer Experience Manager

  • respond to inbound queries via email and live chat, with accuracy and speed

  • liaise directly with Thriva Specialists, reporting doctors, our nurse agency, and our partner labs

  • carry out daily quality assurance and tone of voice checks on customer support agents’ emails

  • manage social media customer support across Facebook, Twitter and Instagram with the aim of developing a Thriva community

  • monitor and optimitise the Thriva help-centre (FAQs) by updating articles and preemptively writing new ones, all in the Thriva tone

  • be an expert on what our customers wants and ensure they’re at the centre of everything we do


This role is on a full time basis, Monday to Friday, 9am to 6pm, with the potential inclusion of an occasional weekend day. You’ll work from our Farringdon office, with the option to work from home once in a while.


This is a great opportunity to join one of London’s fastest growing start-ups.


 


Requirements


You’ll have the following traits:



  • Patient and empathetic – we’re dealing with people’s health so it’s important we go the extra mile to help them to ensure the best possible customer experience.

  • A great communicator – you’ll need to be confident

  • Organised with a high attention to detail – you’ll be juggling lots of different things at once so you’ll need to keep cool-headed and focussed under pressure.

  • Ambitious and passionate – a startup means there’s ample room for development, both for our company and for your career. A thirst for learning and growing is key.

  • Intuitive and proactive – we’re a small team so you’ll need to think quickly on your feet, be good at problem solving and always be ready to come up with ideas.

  • Technically proficient.


A love of healthcare and technology is a plus!


 


What’s it like to work at Thriva?


You’ll be working alongside humble people who truly care about what we’re building and how it can help people.


We’re creating something entirely new and we’re aware that we don’t know everything. So we’re constantly trying new things to understand how we can improve people's lives. We set quarterly goals which means you’ll always know what you’re doing tomorrow is going to help grow the company over the next few months.


While we do have teams with different specialties and focus, most of our work spans across multiple areas. This means you’ll work with lots of different people on a range of challenging problems.


 


Benefits



  • Competitive salary

  • 28 days holiday a year for some well deserved time off (excluding bank holidays, when you will work from home)

  • Choose your own equipment and setup

  • Monthly team activities including away days to Cognac, escape challenges, terrarium building and pottery workshops

  • 3% contribution to your pension

  • Annual “treat yourself” budget

  • Advanced Thriva tests each month

  • A well-equipped central London office with plenty of snacks, fresh fruit and a great espresso machine


 


Thriva is proud to be an equal opportunities employer.


We embrace diversity at Thriva. To build a product that is loved by everyone we need a team with all kinds of different perspectives, experiences and backgrounds. That's why we're committed to hiring people regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age or disability.


We understand that applying for a new job takes a lot of work and we really value your time.


Samantha is looking forward to reading your application.

items.title: Flutter App developer Intern
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Flutter App developer Intern - Remote Niyah


We are offering a chance to join an early-stage startup for a hands-on internship, working directly with the founders in a flat structure. We’re in the early stages of building our fintech startup and so you can expect to be exposed to a variety of tasks: we can give you as much opportunity and responsibility as you’re ready for.


Actively contribute through participation in the agile development of project timelines, implementation design specifications, system flow diagrams, documentation, testing, and ongoing support of systems As a Flutter App developer Intern, you will get to work with a super smart bunch of people who are doing state of the art development work.


You will experience Niyah and what defines our culture while honing the skills which separate our development team from others. You will receive mentorship, and gain insight into our values-driven process. Our goal is both to support your growth and development while empowering you for a successful start to your career.


You would be a good fit for Niyah if you are:



  • Already knowledgeable and have programming efficiency in HTML and JavaScript and Flutter or eager to learn about new technologies

  • Bonus point if you are familiar with modern web applications, HTTPS and REST APIs

  • Fast learner able to adapt quickly

  • Eager to learn about new technologies and build high-quality software, with great attention to detail

  • Enthusiastic about teamwork

  • Strong communication skills, verbal and written


What’s in it for you



  • Opportunity for personal growth in a fast-moving startup. You’ll learn as much in a month at Niyah as you would in a year at a large company

  • Working directly with the founders in a very flat structure

  • We are one team, working together. Everyone’s opinion is valued

  • A diverse team that blends several nationalities and combines deep tech expertise with business profiles


What it takes to succeed



  • Passion for product and high-quality software and eagerness to learn about new technologies

  • Understanding the value of strong testing

  • Ability to work in small teams

  • Ambition to disrupt a stale industry (Banking)

items.title: Food Waste Hero Support intern
items.content:
SOLVING THE PROBLEM OF FOOD WASTE


OLIO is the world’s only neighbour-to-neighbour food sharing app, and our mission is to solve the problem of food waste in the home & local community. We do this by connecting anyone with spare food – which can be households or local businesses – with neighbours living nearby who would like it. Globally, over one third of all the food we produce gets thrown away, which is worth over $1 trillion. What few people realise however is that in the developed world, over half of all food waste takes place in the home, with the average UK family throwing away £800 of food each year - collectively adding up to £15bn. OLIO solves this with our award-winning mobile & web apps.


Over the past 4 years OLIO has grown from a local initiative in North London to a global movement. We now have 1.3 million users who have together shared well over 2.3 million portions of food– with food being successfully shared in 49 countries and counting. Underpinning this incredible growth has been our Food Waste Heroes programme, with over 5,000 registered Food Waste Hero users who rescue food from local businesses, take it home and shared it with their neighbours via the OLIO app. OLIO is now looking for an intern to join the core team as we embark upon the next exciting phase in our journey.


 


INTERNSHIP OPPORTUNITY – LONDON and REMOTE


To support the OLIO team and OLIO Food Waste Heroes, we are recruiting for a Food Waste Hero Support intern. You will report into Anna Lopez-Fujimaki, Food Waste Hero Supply & Support Associate.


The Food Waste Heroes (FWHs) programme involves OLIO matching small groups of waste-busting volunteers with their local street food market, farmers’ market, shop, café, bakery, deli, greengrocer, hotel or restaurant. Once matched, the FWHs provide a service by collecting any unsold surplus food at the end of the day. Food Waste Heroes then use the OLIO app to re-distribute the saved food within their local community.


In this role you will be responsible for:



  • Supporting the OLIO Food Waste Hero Community on a broad range of topics (sharing on OLIO, food safety, Food Waste Hero registration and training, reaching out to local businesses) via a broad variety of channels (social media, email, customer service software, WhatsApp, telephone)

  • Supporting the OLIO Food Waste Hero team with admin tasks as needed, such as registering participating food businesses on the OLIO systems and ensuring compliance with OLIO’s policies

  • Responding to volunteers’ emails using HelpScout (customer service software)

  • Stepping in to rescue and redistribute food to the local community (London only, if London-based) as and when needed to stop good food from going to waste and to maintain food business donor relations


All of our roles are remote working roles, however for London based team members there is the ability to co-work as well. We live for our mission, but like to have fun along the way!


 


IS THIS YOU?


Our ideal internship candidate will first and foremost be as passionate about our mission as we are! In addition to this, you will have the following experience and skills:



  • Projects, university or voluntary work in the field of social good or environmentalism

  • A high level of organisational skills and attention to detail

  • Articulate and extroverted, with the ability to explain things in simple terms

  • Confident working with people from all walks of life


And all OLIO team members share these attributes:



  • A self-starter with a ‘can-do’ attitude o Resourceful and creative

  • Thorough, but able to move quickly and decisively

  • A ruthless ability to prioritise

  • Excellent communication skills

  • Fun to work with ☺


 


PLEASE NOTE: This is an unpaid internship for fully enrolled university students who want to put theory into practice and see the inside of a fast-growing start-up. The applicant must have the right to work in the UK.

items.title: Operations Intern (B2B Software / SaaS)
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
For immediate start - October 2019


About us


Crozdesk.com runs software marketplaces and comparison sites helping businesses globally decide on which software solutions to use. From CRM to Accounting and Marketing Automation to Supply Chain Management - we cover 250+ categories of business software and compare almost everything for our users! Our vendor solutions portal helps thousands of software companies connect with their ideal customers.


We have a dynamic team that's distributed globally with our head office (4 - 5 people) based in Shoreditch, London - which is where you will be located.


If you like a collaborative and productive environment in which responsibilities are shared and where you'll come in contact with all aspects of the business, you'll fit right in.


The Internship


We are looking for a graduate or student, with an entrepreneurial spirit, a hands-on attitude and a knack for details, to join us for a 3+ months internship. You’ll be part of a small startup team, working on data-driven marketing and operations projects, across several products and business functions. You will get the chance to work with partners, software vendors, users and colleagues, to refine, test and tweak internal marketing and ops initiatives. This will involve handling large amounts of data, working on data-driven search engine optimisation (SEO) projects and many online systems (e.g. CRMs, analytics programs, etc.) - so, technical acumen and analytical thinking are key.


The internship is best suited for well-rounded candidates who don’t mind a challenge, are looking to learn and be part of an environment where responsibilities are shared regardless of the job title.


Requirements


- Previous work experience B2B tech, startups or demonstrable interest in all things tech


- A Bachelor's degree or above (in progress or completed), ideally focussed on business administration or scientific subjects


- An understanding of SaaS / business software and marketplaces in general


- Experience working with large datasets (Excel, Google Sheets, etc)


- Excellent written and verbal communication skills


- The ability to foster and grow client relationships


- An entrepreneurial mindset and good technical acumen


Internship Salary: £1450 per month


Join us at Crozdesk and become part of our fast-paced, close-knit team in a flexible role with plenty of responsibilities and room for growth!
